title: Stock Futures, Oil Drop on Omicron Vaccine Concerns
sub_head: Investors await Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s testimony for insight on what the variant could mean for inflation and rate rises
body:
U.S. stock futures fell and investors sheltered in government bonds after drugmakers raised concerns that Covid-19 vaccines won’t work as well against the new Omicron strain.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 fell 1.1%, while blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average Futures shed 1.5%. Technology-heavy Nasdaq-100 futures weakened by 0.5%. Major indexes closed higher Monday, rebounding from a sharp selloff last week, as concerns about the variant seemed to ease.
